image.altText: A group of young pelicans stand in the water of a lagoon

props.synopsis:
After decades of environmental degradation, South Australia's internationally significant Coorong wetlands are now at risk of becoming a "wasteland" due to the state's toxic algal bloom, advocates fear.

Â

title.children: Coorong 'on the brink' amid fears algal bloom could be final straw

image.altText: SES volunteers removing water following a flood in a basement.

props.synopsis: A man who was found in his underwear and chewing on an espresso pod after setting off fire hydrants on six levels of a building in Adelaide's CBD, causing millions of dollars of damage, has been jailed for at least 18 months.

title.children: Man who flooded medical research centre by setting off fire hydrants jailed

image.altText: A man and a woman inside a camper van.

props.synopsis: Outback murderer Bradley Murdoch's death could present a fresh opportunity to find the remains of his victim, British backpacker Peter Falconio, according to a leading forensic expert.

title.children: Killer's death presents 'opportunity' to find Falconio's remains

image.altText: A blue sculpture among pavers and trees.

props.synopsis: A controversial sculpture that sparked complaints about its cost and design arrives in Mount Gambier to a positive reception.

title.children: 'Blue blob' or 'beloved new landmark'? It's got this city talking

image.altText: Outback flooding in South Australia's far north.

props.synopsis: The South Australian and federal governments purchase a new barge that can transport livestock and tourists from Channel Country communities that could be isolated for eight months.

title.children: Relief for flooded communities as governments refloat $27m barge service

image.altText: SANFL and Australian rules football legend Barrie Robran.

props.synopsis: Australian rules football champion and Hall of Fame legend Barrie Robran is being remembered as "an icon, a mentor, and a true gentleman" following his death at the age of 77.

title.children: Australian rules football legend Barrie Robran dies aged 77

image.altText: A man with a long white beard wearing a beanie sits in front of a window with a serious expression

props.synopsis: Ngarrindjeri Elder Uncle Major 'Moogy' Sumner says he is worried an Indigenous man inside South Australia's high-security prison could become "another death in custody", following claims he has self-harmed multiple times while behind bars. WARNING: This story contains reference to self-harm and suicide.

title.children: Elder warns Indigenous man in high-security prison is in 'dire situation'

image.altText: A pig with a dark background behind it.

props.synopsis: Footage taken by an activist group allegedly in a piggery north of Adelaide shows pigs feeding on carcasses, some belonging to other pigs. WARNING: this story contains graphic content that may distress readers.

title.children: Cannibalism footage sparks animal welfare investigation at SA piggery

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese has visited a panda conservation centre in China as he finishes his six-day trip to the country. Follow live.

title.children: Panda diplomacy on display during PM's final day of China visit

image.altText: An Australian border force officer in uniform holds a box of vapes in gold packaging

props.synopsis: Almost half a billon dollars worth of vapes have been taken off the street since new laws came into force 18 months ago as research shows fewer young Australians are taking up vaping.

title.children: More than 10 million vapes seized since 2024 import ban

image.altText: A man pours red wine into a glass on a table set with cutlery and a napkins.

props.synopsis: Australia crushed more red wine grapes this year but fewer people are drinking it, prompting warnings of a worsening wine glut.

title.children: Australia's red wine glut likely to get worse

image.altText: Woman sits in a chair in a psychologist's office as they show her something on a clipboard.

props.synopsis: A number of states have indicated they will soon allow GPs to diagnose ADHD, but doctors warn patients may still face out-of-pocket costs or have difficulty accessing prescriptions.

title.children: GPs set to diagnose ADHD, but say appointments unlikely to be bulk-billed

image.altText: A man in glasses and a suit outside glass doors

props.synopsis: A South Australian police officer injured in a shooting which killed Brevet Sergeant Jason Doig in 2023 has recounted the moment he held his dying colleague in his arms. Another officer shared her guilt for unknowingly leading her colleagues into "a nightmare".

title.children: Police officer describes moment he held dying colleague in his arms after ambush

image.altText: A person pointing to a passage in a children's book

props.synopsis: Children who experience domestic violence are often left without a voice. A new storybook written by ten children who have lived experience sheds a light on the profound impact of family violence. Warning: This story contains content that may cause distress for some readers.

title.children: 'Dad is like a tornado': Children capture domestic violence through storytelling

image.altText: A woman with a scarf sitting in an armchair next to a cabinet with vases on top

props.synopsis: A South Australian woman who feared she might not make it while waiting for heart surgery has been told her life-saving procedure has been scheduled for next week.

title.children: Patient fears she will die waiting for pacemaker amid surgery delay

image.altText: Man and woman in selfie photograph

props.synopsis: Police will allege a 15-year-old and 17-year-old broke into Zdravko Bilic's house on Sunday night and were disturbed by the 57-year-old who sustained fatal stab wounds.

title.children: Teens charged with murder over Sunshine Coast stabbing

image.altText: Five people stand around a person who is sitting on the ground with his hands handcuffed behind his back.

props.synopsis: A man has been charged over the theft of a car connected to the December 2024 fire that destroyed the Adass Israel Synagogue in Melbourne's inner south-east.

title.children: Terrorism unit charges man over theft of car linked to Melbourne synagogue attack

image.altText: A group of people pose for a photo, all are blurred except for Erin Scutter in the front row, wearing a pink top.

props.synopsis: The aviation sector has been home to two of the nation's most high-profile murderers, however, documents reveal Airservices Australia and CASA have not reviewed their systems of psychometric testing.

title.children: No aviation psychometric test review after Erin Patterson, Greg Lynn cases

image.altText: A screenshot showing how the darcula v3 software works.

props.synopsis: Sophisticated subscription services that use multiple languages and can mimic legitimate brands are being used by criminals to trick consumers into visiting fake websites.

title.children: New DIY software allows criminals to clone any website

image.altText: Colouring pencils in a plastic container.

props.synopsis: The 21-year-old man is alleged to have committed the offence last week at a childcare centre operated by Affinity Education Group.

title.children: Brisbane childcare worker charged with indecent treatment of 4yo

image.altText: A person in a hard hat works on a huge metal pipe system inside a concrete tunnel, with a bike to one side.

props.synopsis: Current models of physics dictate there should be as much antimatter in the universe as matter, but there isn't. Work at the world's largest particle collider has come a step closer to explaining why.Â

title.children: Atom smasher spots new clue to explain why the universe exists

image.altText: people standing by lake

props.synopsis: Jaye Lee Walton has been denied bail after he was charged with the alleged manslaughter of his seven-month-old son on the Sunshine Coast.Â

title.children: Man charged with manslaughter over death of baby son denied bail

image.altText: The bonnent of an NT police car that reads "police" and has the NT police force emblem. Green leaves blurred in right corner.

props.synopsis: Police have charged the 34-year-old man with sexual intercourse with a child under 10, over an incident at a Ludmilla home last month.

title.children: Man charged with rape of child under 10 in Darwin's northern suburbs

image.altText: A woman holding her daughter in her arms for a selfie photo

props.synopsis: Tech giant Meta bans and then reinstates an Australian woman's Instagram account, wrongly accusing her business page of posting child exploitation material.

title.children: Australians angry as Meta bans accounts with few appeal avenues

image.altText: Grace Tame

props.synopsis: Former Australian of the Year Grace Tame says the government is moving too slowly to protect children online, as advocates meet at parliament urging that AI tools used to create child abuse material be criminalised.

title.children: Grace Tame urges government to criminalise AI tools used for child abuse

image.altText: A small shark in the water, attached to a fishing line

props.synopsis: Researchers were "beginning to wonder if they even existed", but have finally found a new species of worm parasite on a shark after a 20-year worldwide search.

title.children: Rare worm parasite, first of its kind, found feasting on shark

image.altText: A huge fire engulfs a large stage with huge ice-like decorations

props.synopsis: Organisers say they are "finding solutions for the festival weekend", which is now just days away.

title.children: Tomorrowland's main stage catches fire days before festival

image.altText: A young man with tousled blond hair, wearing a long-sleeved black top, with his arms folded

props.synopsis: Brandon Jack draws on his time as a peripheral player in the AFL in his raucous new novel, Pissants.

title.children: Ex-AFL player pens debut novel set in debauched AFL fringe

image.altText: A soldier in camouflage fatigues looks down the sights of a rifle during a drill held near school buildings.

props.synopsis: Taiwan, wary of increasing pressure from Beijing, has beefed up its defence drills and is training citizens of all ages to be ready for any forceful attempts to make it join the People's Republic of China.

title.children: Taiwan runs largest defence drills as pressure from Beijing mounts

image.altText: A close up of a woman with a white dress and pixie cut

props.synopsis: Watson, 35, was banned for driving at 38 miles per hour (61kph) in a 30-mile zone in south-east England.

title.children: Harry Potter actress Emma Watson banned from driving after speeding

image.altText: A large lizard with it's mouth open to the camera.

props.synopsis: Ecologist Kristoffer Wild spent a year in the Australian outback fitting bearded dragons with hand-sewn jackets with GPS trackers to track every second of the lizards' lives.

title.children: Bearded dragons in backpacks reveal speed can be a killer

image.altText: An Aboriginal child in a black adidas shirt holding an Aboriginal toddler in a white and balck shirt, on a basketball court

props.synopsis: The Kumanjayi Walker Inquest backs Aboriginal-led solutions and restoring Warlpiri self-determination, which his family says will "prevent deaths in custody".

title.children: Police shooting of Kumanjayi Walker could lead to NT communities taking back full control

image.altText: Young man wearing beanie and glasses sits across a bench with legs straight out in front and a laptop in his lap.

props.synopsis: A new study finds neurodiverse uni students are concerned about being labelled if they ask for support, and that training for staff on how best to support neurodivergent students is "sorely needed".

title.children: Neurodiverse uni students say discrimination and lack of support rife

image.altText: Woman laughing behind the wheel of a large vehicle.

props.synopsis: Heather Ewart was a powerhouse political reporter when she was asked to create a show about regional Australia. A decade later, and with her final season going to air, Ewart admits that getting the idea off the ground was no easy feat.

title.children: Heather Ewart signs off from Back Roads after 10 years telling tales from the bush
